newsitem.title: UK: Texaco confirms taking 20 pct Karachaganak gas stake.
newsitem.headline: Texaco confirms taking 20 pct Karachaganak gas stake.

text.p: Texaco Inc has confirmed it plans to acquire a stake in Kazahkstan's $10 billion Karachaganak oil and gas project.
Texaco had agreed with Karachaganak operators British Gas Plc and Italy's Agip SpA on a 20 percent stake in the field, Texaco said in its company magazine.

"This is the right time to be in Kazahkstan. There are huge reserves, immediate cash flow from existing production, and at least one bankable export route," said Texaco's President of International Production Bob Solberg.
Karachaganak, with estimated commercial reserves of more than 3.5 billion barrels of oil, gas and gas condensates, would become Texaco's biggest producer worldwide, the magazine said.
Formal government approval for Texaco's investment would leave British Gas and Agip each holding a 32.5 percent stake in the field.
Russia's LUKoil LKOH.RTS is taking the remaining 15 percent share previously held by Russian gas monopoly Gazprom.
British Gas and Agip signed a two-year extendable deal in March 1995 for the field, which will be developed over 40 years on a production-sharing basis.
Texaco said a final production sharing agreement is expected later this year.
